name: df-edring
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(cedring, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpt(s1, cfv(clh, cv(s0)), ctp(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cfv(cfv(ctendo, cv(s0)), cv(s1))), cop(cfv(cplusg, cnx), cmpo(s2, s3, cfv(cfv(ctendo, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cfv(cfv(ctendo, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cmpt(s4, cfv(cfv(cltrn, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), ccom(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4)), cfv(cv(s3), cv(s4)))))), cop(cfv(cmulr, cnx), cmpo(s2, s3, cfv(cfv(ctendo, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cfv(cfv(ctendo, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), ccom(cv(s2), cv(s3))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ EDRing =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà(LHyp ` s0)‚Ü¶ { <(Base ` ndx),((TEndo ` s0)` s1)>, <(+ ` ndx),(s2 ‚àà((TEndo ` s0)` s1), s3 ‚àà((TEndo ` s0)` s1)‚Ü¶(s4 ‚àà((LTrn ` s0)` s1)‚Ü¶((s2 ` s4)‚àò(s3 ` s4))))>, <(√ó ` ndx),(s2 ‚àà((TEndo ` s0)` s1), s3 ‚àà((TEndo ` s0)` s1)‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àò s3))> }))
comment: Define division ring on trace-preserving endomorphisms. The multiplication operation is reversed composition, per the definition of E of [Crawley] p. 117, 4th line from bottom. (Contributed by NM, 8-Jun-2013.)
